citations.narrative:
The cage cards being used at the facility as identification for 32 puppies did not contain all required information. The cage
cards did not contain a unique number identifying each puppy or a description and the puppies were not microchipped.
Complete and accurate records are needed to ensure each animal's identity can be known with certainty and to facilitate
the ability to trace all puppies. The facility shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly
disclose the following information concerning each dog or cat purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise
in his or her possession or under his or her control, or which is transported, euthanized, sold, or otherwise disposed of by
that dealer or exhibitor. The records shall include any offspring born of any animal while in his or her possession or under
his or her control. Correct by 07-April-2025.

The food being provided in a self-feeding receptacle for 2 adult dogs is not being adequately protected from
contamination. The food receptacle has an open top and is oriented below a post holding a deep cell battery that has
excessive corrosion present. The wooden frame holding the battery has an approximately 1-inch of yellow/orange/white
buildup around the base and there is dried liquid residue down the frame. Failure to ensure that food is free of
contamination can lead to ingestion of toxic substances and negatively impact the health of the animals. The licensee
must ensure that food is uncontaminated, wholesome, palatable, and of sufficient quantity and nutritive value to maintain
the normal condition and weight of the animal. Correct by, 07-April-2025.

Fecal testing has not been performed in accordance with the schedule that was approved by the Attending Veterinarian.
Failure to follow a written and Attending Veterinarian approved schedule for sampling and treatment of parasites and
other pests can lead to a delay in treatment for the animals in the facility. The licensee must ensure that sampling and
treatment of parasites and other pests in accordance with a schedule approved by the Attending Veterinarian is followed.
Correct by, 07-April-2025.

The facility does not have medical records as described in this section. The identification of the dogs is recorded using tag
numbers that are no longer in use. The dogs are currently identified using microchips that are not recorded in the medical
records. The facility states that all dogs have received the required vaccinations, but all vaccinations have not been
recorded in the medical records. It is required that all preventions, vaccinations, treatments, and testing be recorded in the
animal’s medical record. Failure to keep accurate medical records inhibits APHIS inspectors to evaluate the quality of
medical care provided by the facility. The facility must record all treatments, testing, preventions vaccinations and all other
medical procedures required by section 3.13 in medical records maintained for each animal at the facility. Correct by, 07-
April-2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Facility Representative.
n

narrative:
2.75(a)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The cage cards being used at the facility as identification for 32 puppies did not contain all required information. The cage 
cards did not contain a unique number identifying each puppy or a description and the puppies were not microchipped. 
Complete and accurate records are needed to ensure each animal's identity can be known with certainty and to facilitate 
the ability to trace all puppies. The facility shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly 
disclose the following information concerning each dog or cat purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise 
in his or her possession or under his or her control, or which is transported, euthanized, sold, or otherwise disposed of by 
that dealer or exhibitor. The records shall include any offspring born of any animal while in his or her possession or under 
his or her control. Correct by 07-April-2025. 
3.9(a) 
   
Feeding 
The food being provided in a self-feeding receptacle for 2 adult dogs is not being adequately protected from 
contamination. The food receptacle has an open top and is oriented below a post holding a deep cell battery that has 
excessive corrosion present. The wooden frame holding the battery has an approximately 1-inch of yellow/orange/white 
buildup around the base and there is dried liquid residue down the frame. Failure to ensure that food is free of 
contamination can lead to ingestion of toxic substances and negatively impact the health of the animals. The licensee 
must ensure that food is uncontaminated, wholesome, palatable, and of sufficient quantity and nutritive value to maintain 
the normal condition and weight of the animal. Correct by, 07-April-2025. 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Fecal testing has not been performed in accordance with the schedule that was approved by the Attending Veterinarian. 
Failure to follow a written and Attending Veterinarian approved schedule for sampling and treatment of parasites and 
other pests can lead to a delay in treatment for the animals in the facility. The licensee must ensure that sampling and 
treatment of parasites and other pests in accordance with a schedule approved by the Attending Veterinarian is followed. 
Correct by, 07-April-2025. 
3.13(b)

Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility does not have medical records as described in this section. The identification of the dogs is recorded using tag 
numbers that are no longer in use. The dogs are currently identified using microchips that are not recorded in the medical 
records. The facility states that all dogs have received the required vaccinations, but all vaccinations have not been 
recorded in the medical records. It is required that all preventions, vaccinations, treatments, and testing be recorded in the 
animal’s medical record. Failure to keep accurate medical records inhibits APHIS inspectors to evaluate the quality of 
medical care provided by the facility. The facility must record all treatments, testing, preventions vaccinations and all other 
medical procedures required by section 3.13 in medical records maintained for each animal at the facility. Correct by, 07-
April-2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Facility Representative.
